text: Oh yeah I heard he's starting up a Youtube channel! He's going to do so well with it, I'm really hoping it takes off for him because it really seems to be something that'll make him happy and what he really wants to end up doing :slightly_smiling_face:

Oh you have friends at Cosa? I also have a few friends over there right now lol Have you already tried applying at places for intern positions?

Games are definitely on a different level technically compared to VFX. In VFX you aren't nearly as limited in things as in games. Ah I never thought about checking out developer blogs and stuff, that'd be a great idea to see breakdown of how things work or how they cheat things to get the best optimization on things. I do play tons of different video games like I'm on Dragon Quest Builders 2 and Fallout 4 right now. I'll definitely have to take a look at some developers twitter accounts or blogs. :slightly_smiling_face: Never thought about looking at that. Thanks for the advice!

I haven't really looked at any resources for real time VFX but know a few sites from trying to learn how to model/texture for real time.

attachments.title: All Courses | lynda.com
attachments.text: Download the <http://Lynda.com|Lynda.com> app to enjoy on-the-go learning.
attachments.fallback: Lynda.com - from LinkedIn: All Courses | lynda.com

text: I believe you can get an account for <http://Lynda.com|Lynda.com> for free if you have a Los Angeles Public Library card :slightly_smiling_face:

Woah you did that with just a cylinder?! Impressive Nick! lol Yeah you seem to have done quiet a bit of things already, I'd say once you update your website with a demo reel and some more current projects you've worked on with breakdowns, I think you'll be set to start working somewhere!

And yes I'm trying to learn more about procedral modeling in Houdini! We've had an artist demonstrate an examples of making procedral asteroid belt with Houdini and it was extremely impressive! I usually get stuck with modeling skyscrapers so I think I'm going to learn how to do that procedrally next. :slightly_smiling_face:

Btw, are you okay with this back and forth daily? Or did you want to set a time to both be online and talk? I don't mind either way I just want you to feel like I'm helping you get somewhere, which with this daily message thing could be a bit slow lol
